meanings.definition: Not guilty; free from blame or fault.
meanings.sent1: The cat was inculpable for knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent2: She was found inculpable of the crime after a thorough investigation.
meanings.sent3: The inculpable puppy wagged its tail innocently, unaware of the mess it had made.
meanings.sent4: The clear blue sky seemed inculpable of any wrongdoing, a perfect backdrop for the day.
meanings.sent5: Her smile was as inculpable as a ray of sunshine, bringing joy to everyone around her.

meanings.sent1: The child's laughter was inculpable, bringing joy to all who heard it.
meanings.sent2: He remained inculpable despite the false accusations against him.
meanings.sent3: The inculpable squirrel innocently gathered nuts for the winter, unaware of the chaos it caused in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The inculpable flower bloomed beautifully, untouched by the troubles of the world.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes held an inculpable innocence, reflecting a pure and kind soul.
